intro: Lysipomia laciniata subsp. fissicalyx, commonly known as the fissicalyx leafflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
